content.description: Perhaps a better name would be "While Lemmon Burned". But whatever.Easy start, gets steeper and harder.  Our rating could be a touch sandbag. Rock quality is primo.
content.location: 2nd route from left.  Starts a few feet right of Et Tu Brute.

climbs.name: I Came, I Saw, I Sent

content.description: I like this little roped boulder prob. The stone is flawless. The holds make me grin. It gets harder as you go. It even overhangs a little. A slightly weak 2 star from me.At first we weren't sure there were enough holds. But they jump out when you get on it, and they are better than expected. Mostly.Last FA before big June 5 fire shut down Lemmon. Forest service says will reopen by Nov 1.
content.location: The right-most route. Starts at little tree grove in the middle of the base of the crag and pulls onto a sloping ledge. Then move right onto cool holds and steeper rock.

content.description: An overhanging 8/9 on Lemmon ? Yep. Reminds me of X-Ray at Raycray just not QUITE as good. Top notch rock quality and cool holds.  Great finish. Good warmup for those headed to Continuum or Spectrum. Morning shade.
content.location: Lower left side of face. Basically starts at lowest point along base of crag. An old burned stump currently marks the start.

content.description:
Spectr-um, Continu-um and now For-um. All part of a cluster of crags with some of highest quality stone on Lemmon.

 By itself Forum is no kind of destination.  But since it is on the way to Spectrum, we thought "why not ?". Going to Spectrum or Continuum you walk right next to it.

 Morning shade, just like all the other crags nearby.
